intro: Senecio lopez-guillenii, commonly known as Lopez-Guillen's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and features narrow, linear leaves. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
